response_requirements.initial_response_description: Designated public records person shall notify applicant within 7 business days from acknowledged receipt; all records released not later than 30 calendar days from acknowledged receipt
response_requirements.final_response_notes: 7 business day acknowledgment + 30 calendar day maximum production (records readily available released immediately unless would impair operations)
response_requirements.extension_notes: Extensions permitted with good cause (volume, review needs, staff limitations, operational constraints)
response_requirements.good_faith_standard: Records readily available shall be released immediately unless release would impair or impede agency operations

fee_structure.search_fee: May charge reasonable fees for search and retrieval time
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge reasonable fees for search/retrieval time based on actual costs incurred
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Reasonable fees for reproduction including staff time for copying, materials and supplies
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Additional fees for special format requests
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: May require advance payment if estimated cost exceeds reasonable amount; must provide written estimate
fee_structure.reasonableness_standard: All fees must be reasonable and based on actual costs

exemptions.description: Public records do not include those privileged or confidential by law
Personnel records with personal information, medical/health records, student educational records, personal identifiers
Active criminal investigation files, intelligence/investigative information, records interfering with proceedings
Internal deliberative materials during decision-making process

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Any person denied access may petition district court for writ of mandamus. Governmental entity bears burden of proving exemption.
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court costs and reasonable attorney fees to substantially prevailing petitioner

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Requests should be made in writing to designated records person; law does not require statement of purpose and does not restrict use of records
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written request recommended but not strictly required; any person has right of inspection
requester_requirements.specific_format: No specific format required - written request recommended

agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: Custodian shall allow any person the right of inspection of records
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: Electronic records have same status as physical records; may request in electronic format
agency_obligations.response_format_options: May request records in electronic format; fees may apply for electronic formatting
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Personal information redacted unless specifically authorized
agency_obligations.liberal_interpretation: Right of inspection is fundamental; exemptions must be specifically provided by law

oversight_body.name: Public Records Ombudsman
oversight_body.role: Governor-designated position; assists public with access, mediates disputes, provides guidance

official_resources.request_portal_notes: Wyoming Administration and Information maintains directory of designated public records persons

primary_sources: Wyoming Statutes Title 16, Chapter 4, Article 2, §§ 16-4-201 through 16-4-205
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Wyoming statutes. Response time set to null/variable per ground truth (7 business day acknowledgment + 30 calendar day maximum production). Designated public records person required. Public Records Ombudsman assists. Training requirements for personnel. District court enforcement via mandamus. Attorney fees for substantially prevailing petitioners. Burden on governmental entity to prove exemption.
